name: The Christmas Story from the Gospel of Luke Trivia Game | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was governor of Syria when Caesar Augustus believed that everyone should be taxed, according to Luke 2:2?
questions.explanation:
Cyrenius.

	Cyrenius' name means warrior. It can also be written as Quirinus. He took over as governor around A.D. 6 after Archelaus was banished from Syria.

questions.text: Where did Joseph go to be taxed, according to Luke 2:4?
questions.explanation:
Bethlehem.

	Verse 4 states that the reason for this was Joseph was part of David's lineage. If you read the genealogy in Luke 3, it shows that Mary (Jesus' mother) was also of David's lineage.

questions.text: Why did Mary put Jesus in the manger, according to Luke 2:7?
questions.correct: There was no room in the inn.
options: All babies back then were put in mangers.
Someone else was using the crib.
She thought the haystack would be too itchy.
questions.explanation:
There was no room in the inn.

	A manger is a feeding trough found in a barn. This is why the animals were all present at Jesus' birth.

questions.text: Who was "abiding in the fields", according to Luke 2:8?
questions.explanation:
shepherds.

	It says they were "watching the flock by night" (Luke 2:8 KJV). Later on Jesus says in John 10:14 (KJV) "I am the good Shepherd, and know my sheep and am known of mine."

questions.text: Who did the angel say was born? (Luke 2:11 KJV)
questions.explanation:
Christ the Lord.

	The angel also said that He is the Savior. The angel then tells the shepherds where to find Christ, "wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger." (Luke 2:12 KJV)

questions.text: What did the multitude of angels say when they were praising God in Luke 2:14 (KJV)?
questions.correct: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men
options: Glory to the new born King
God you rock, thank you for sending the humans a Savior
questions.explanation:
Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.

	After the angels left, the shepherds decided to go and see the Christ child. According to most Bible Scholars all angels are male.

questions.text: What happened on the 8th day of Christ's life?
questions.correct: He was circumcised and named Jesus
options: He hugged his mother for the first time
questions.explanation:
He was circumcised and named Jesus.

	Mary was told ,when she was first told she would have a child, to name him Jesus, which means Savior. It is Jewish custom for a child to be circumcised and officially named on the 8th day of his life.

questions.text: Who was told he would "not see death before he had seen the Lord's Christ"?
questions.explanation:
Simeon.

	Simeon was described as being devout. He met Jesus when Jesus was 40 days old. The number 40 is mentioned 146 times in the Bible. It suggests a time of being tested, having trials or on probation.

questions.text: When Jesus was 12, where did His parents find Him, according to Luke 2:46 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
The temple.

	They looked for Him for three days once they realized He was missing. Back then, people traveled in caravans of about 1,00 people (both "kinfolk and acquaintances" - Luke 2:44 (KJV). So, at first they did not think Jesus was missing but with someone else in the caravan.

questions.text: What did Jesus reply, in Luke 2:49 (KJV), as to why he was in the temple?
questions.correct: How is it that ye sought me? Wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?
options: I promise next time I will stay with you.
Didn't you know I had to obey my Father before you mother?
questions.explanation:
How is it that ye sought me? Wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?.

	Jesus was not being disrespectful to His parents, He was letting them know that what God, His Father, wanted came first and foremost.
